member.name: T:PSFramework.Configuration.Config
member.summary: Configuration Manager as well as individual configuration object.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Name
member.summary: The Name of the setting

member.name: P:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.FullName
member.summary: The full name of the configuration entry, comprised of both Module and Name.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Module
member.summary: The module of the setting. Helps being able to group configurations.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Description
member.summary: A description of the specific setting

member.name: P:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Type
member.summary: The data type of the value stored in the configuration element.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Value
member.summary: The value stored in the configuration element

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Handler
member.summary: The handler script that is run whenever the configuration value is set.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Validation
member.summary: Validates the user input

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Hidden
member.summary: Setting this to true will cause the element to not be discovered unless using the '-Force' parameter on "Get-DbaConfig"

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.Initialized
member.summary: Whether the setting has been initialized. This handles module imports and avoids modules overwriting settings when imported in multiple runspaces.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.PolicySet
member.summary: Whether this setting was set by policy

member.name: P:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.PolicyEnforced
member.summary: Whether this setting was set by policy and forbids deletion.

member.name: P:PSFramework.Configuration.Config.RegistryData
member.summary: The finalized value to put into the registry value when using policy to set this setting.

member.name: T:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigScope
member.summary: The location where a setting was applied

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigScope.UserDefault
member.summary: The configuration is set as default value for the user

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigScope.UserMandatory
member.summary: The configuration is enforced for the user

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigScope.SystemDefault
member.summary: The configuration is set as default value for all users on the system

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigScope.SystemMandatory
member.summary: The configuration is enforced for all users on the system.

member.name: T:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigurationHost
member.summary: Host class providing static configuration settings that are constant across all runspaces within the process.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigurationHost.Configurations
member.summary: Hashtable containing all the configuration entries

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigurationHost.Validation
member.summary: Hashtable containing all the registered validations

member.name: F:PSFramework.Configuration.ConfigurationHost.ImportFromRegistryDone
member.summary: Whether the import from registry has been completed. Prevents multiple imports and overwrites when importing the module multiple times.

member.name: T:PSFramework.License.License
member.summary: Contains license information for a single product

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.Product
member.summary: The name of the product the license is for.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.Manufacturer
member.summary: Who made the license product?

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.ProductVersion
member.summary: The version of the product covered by the license.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.ProductType
member.summary: The type of product the licensed product is.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.LicenseName
member.summary: The name of the license. Useful for the usual public licenses.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.LicenseVersion
member.summary: The version of the license. Useful for the usual public licenses.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.LicenseDate
member.summary: When was the product licensed with the specified license.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.LicenseType
member.summary: The type of the license. This allows filtering licenses by their limitations.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.License.LicenseText
member.summary: The full license text for the pleasure of the reader.

member.name: T:PSFramework.License.LicenseHost
member.summary: Host class covering all static needs of the licensing system.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.LicenseHost.Licenses
member.summary: The list containing all registered licenses.

member.name: M:PSFramework.License.LicenseHost.Add(PSFramework.License.License)
member.summary: Adds a new licenses to the list of registerd licenses.
member.param: The license to add

member.name: M:PSFramework.License.LicenseHost.Clear
member.summary: Removes all registered Licenses

member.name: M:PSFramework.License.LicenseHost.Get
member.summary: Returns all registered licenses

member.name: M:PSFramework.License.LicenseHost.Remove(PSFramework.License.License)
member.summary: Removes a spceific licenses from the list of registerd licenses
member.param: License to remove

member.name: T:PSFramework.License.LicenseType
member.summary: What kind of License is this? By default, a license is a free license allowing modification but requiring attribution.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.LicenseType.Free
member.summary: No special type is present

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.LicenseType.Commercial
member.summary: The license is for a commercial product. This means you have to acquire use permission, such as software licenses, user CALs et al.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.LicenseType.NoAttribution
member.summary: Reusing this product requires no attribution. Just use it and call it your own.

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.LicenseType.NoModify
member.summary: This product may be used, but must not be modified in any way.

member.name: T:PSFramework.License.ProductType
member.summary: What kind of product is being licensed

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.ProductType.Module
member.summary: The product is a PowerShell module

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.ProductType.Script
member.summary: The Product is a Script of any kind

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.ProductType.Library
member.summary: The Product is a library, bringing functionality to the Shell

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.ProductType.Application
member.summary: The Product is a standalone application, that happens to utilize PowerShell

member.name: F:PSFramework.License.ProductType.Other
member.summary: The Product is anything other than the default types

member.name: T:PSFramework.Logging.Provider
member.summary: Class containing all information/content needed for a logging provider

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.Name
member.summary: Each logging provider has a name. Make sure it's unique

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.Enabled
member.summary: Whether the logging provider is enabled. Only when this is set to true will the logging script execute its events.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.Initialized
member.summary: The provider has had its initial runtime configuration (what is stored in the BeginEvent) applied.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.InstallationOptional
member.summary: Whether the provider must be installed, in order for it to be used.

member.name: P:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.IncludeModules
member.summary: List of modules to include in the logging. Only messages generated from these modules will be considered by the provider

member.name: P:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.ExcludeModules
member.summary: List of modules to exclude in the logging. Messages generated from these modules will be ignored by this provider.

member.name: P:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.IncludeTags
member.summary: List of tags to include. Only messages with these tags will be considered by this provider.

member.name: P:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.ExcludeTags
member.summary: List of tags to exclude. Messages with these tags will be ignored by this provider.

member.name: M:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.MessageApplies(PSFramework.Message.LogEntry)
member.summary: Tests whether a log entry applies to the provider
member.param: The Entry to validate

member.name: M:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.MessageApplies(PSFramework.Message.PsfExceptionRecord)
member.summary: Tests whether an error record applies to the provider
member.param: The error record to test
member.returns: Whether it applies to the provider

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.BeginEvent
member.summary: Event that is executed once per logging script execution, before logging occurs

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.StartEvent
member.summary: Event that is executed each logging cycle, right before processing items.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.MessageEvent
member.summary: Event that is executed for each message written

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.ErrorEvent
member.summary: Event that is executed for each error written

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.EndEvent
member.summary: Event that is executed once per logging cycle, after processing all message and error items.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.FinalEvent
member.summary: Final Event that is executed when stopping the logging script.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.IsInstalledScript
member.summary: Script that recognizes, whether the provider has been isntalled correctly. Some providers require installation, in order to function properly.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.InstallationScript
member.summary: Script that installs the provider

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.InstallationParameters
member.summary: Script that generates dynamic parameters for installing the provider.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.ConfigurationParameters
member.summary: Scriptblock that adds additional parameters as needed to the Set-PSFLoggingProvider function

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.Provider.ConfigurationScript
member.summary: The configuration steps taken by the Set-PSFLoggingProvider function

member.name: T:PSFramework.Logging.ProviderHost
member.summary: Provides infrastructure services for the logging provider system

member.name: F:PSFramework.Logging.ProviderHost.Providers
member.summary: Dictionary with all registered logging providers

member.name: M:PSFramework.Logging.ProviderHost.GetEnabled
member.summary: Returns all enabled logging providers

member.name: M:PSFramework.Logging.ProviderHost.GetInitialized
member.summary: Returns all enabled & initialized logging provider

member.summary: The message logged

member.summary: What kind of entry was this?

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntry.Timestamp

member.summary: What level was the message?

member.summary: What runspace was the message written from?

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntry.ComputerName
member.summary: The computer the message was generated on

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntry.TargetObject
member.summary: The object that was the focus of this message.

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.LogEntry.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty log entry

member.summary: Creates a filled out log entry
member.param: The message that was logged
The type(s) of message written
When was the message logged
What function wrote the message
Name of the module the function writing this message came from
Tags that were applied to the message
What level was the message written at.
The ID of the runspace that wrote the message.
The computer the message was generated on.
The object this message was all about.

member.name: T:PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType
member.summary: The kind of information the logged entry was.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType.None
member.summary: This entry wasn't written to any stream

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType.Information
member.summary: A message that was written to the current host equivalent, if available also to the information stream

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType.Verbose
member.summary: A message that was written to the verbose stream

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType.Debug
member.summary: A message that was written to the Debug stream

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType.Warning
member.summary: A message written to the warning stream

member.name: T:PSFramework.Message.LogHost
member.summary: Provides static information storage for logging related settings, as well as housing the logging queues.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxErrorCount
member.summary: The maximum numbers of error records maintained in-memory.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxMessageCount
member.summary: The maximum number of messages that can be maintained in the in-memory message queue

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxMessagefileBytes
member.summary: The maximum size of a given logfile. When reaching this limit, the file will be abandoned and a new log created. Set to 0 to not limit the size.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxMessagefileCount
member.summary: The maximum number of logfiles maintained at a time. Exceeding this number will cause the oldest to be culled. Set to 0 to disable the limit.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxErrorFileBytes
member.summary: The maximum size all error files combined may have. When this number is exceeded, the oldest entry is culled.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxTotalFolderSize
member.summary: This is the upper limit of length all items in the log folder may have combined across all processes.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.LoggingPath
member.summary: Path to where the logfiles live.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MaxLogFileAge
member.summary: Any logfile older than this will automatically be cleansed

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MessageLogFileEnabled
member.summary: Governs, whether a log file for the system messages is written

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.MessageLogEnabled
member.summary: Governs, whether a log of recent messages is kept in memory

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.ErrorLogFileEnabled
member.summary: Governs, whether log files for errors are written

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.ErrorLogEnabled
member.summary: Governs, whether a log of recent errors is kept in memory

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.OutQueueError
member.summary: The outbound queue for errors. These will be processed and written to xml

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.OutQueueLog
member.summary: The outbound queue for logs. These will be processed and written to logfile

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.GetErrors
member.summary: Retrieves a copy of the Error stack
member.returns: All errors thrown by functions using the message or flowcontrol system

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.GetLog
member.summary: Retrieves a copy of the message log

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.WriteErrorEntry(System.Management.Automation.ErrorRecord[],System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.DateTime,System.String,System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Write an error record to the log
member.param: The actual error record as powershell wrote it
The name of the function writing the error
The name of the module the function writing the error came from
The tags that were assigned to the error event
When was the error written
What message was passed to the user
The runspace the message was written from
The computer the error was written on

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.LogHost.WriteLogEntry(System.String,PSFramework.Message.LogEntryType,System.DateTime,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel,System.Guid,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Write a new entry to the log
member.param: The message to log
The type of the message logged
When was the message generated
What function wrote the message
What module did the function writing this message come from?
The tags that were applied to the message
At what level was the function written
The runspace the message is coming from
The computer the message was generated on
The object associated with a given message.
member.returns: The entry that is being written

member.name: T:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost
member.summary: Provides static resources to the messaging subsystem

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MaximumInformation
member.summary: The maximum message level to still display to the user directly.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MaximumVerbose
member.summary: The maxium message level where verbose information is still written.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MaximumDebug
member.summary: The maximum message level where debug information is still written.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MinimumInformation
member.summary: The minimum required message level for messages that will be shown to the user.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MinimumVerbose
member.summary: The minimum required message level where verbose information is written.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MinimumDebug
member.summary: The minimum required message level where debug information is written.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.InfoColor
member.summary: The color stuff gets written to the console in

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.InfoColorEmphasis
member.summary: The color important stuff gets written to the console in

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.InfoColorSubtle
member.summary: The color background stuff gets written to the console in

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.DeveloperColor
member.summary: The color stuff gets written to the console in, when developer mode is enabled and the message would not have been written after all

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.DeveloperMode
member.summary: Enables the developer mode. In this all messages are written to the console, in order to make it easier to troubleshoot issues.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.NestedLevelDecrement
member.summary: Message levels can decrease by nested level. This causes messages to have an increasingly reduced level as the size of the callstack increases.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.TransformErrorQueueSize
member.summary: The size of the transform error queue. When adding more than this, the oldest entry will be discarded

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.ExceptionTransforms
member.summary: Provides the option to transform exceptions based on the original exception type

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.TargetTransforms
member.summary: Provides the option to transform target objects based on type. This is sometimes important when working with live state objects that should not be serialized.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.TransformErrors
member.summary: The list of transformation errors that occured.

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.GetTransformErrors
member.summary: Returns the current queue of failed transformations
member.returns: The list of transformations that failed

member.summary: Writes a new transform error
member.param: The record of what went wrong
The name of the function writing the transformed message
The module the function writing the transformed message is part of
The object that should have been transformed
The type of transform that was attempted
The runspace it all happened on

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.ExceptionTransformList
member.summary: List of custom transforms for exceptions

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.TargetTransformlist
member.summary: List of custom transforms for targets

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.MessageLevelModifiers
member.summary: List of all modifiers that apply to message levels

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageHost.Events
member.summary: List of events that subscribe to messages being written

member.name: T:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel
member.summary: The various levels of verbosity available.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Critical
member.summary: Very important message, should be shown to the user as a high priority

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Important
member.summary: Important message, the user should read this

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Output
member.summary: Important message, the user should read this

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Host
member.summary: Important message, the user should read this

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Significant
member.summary: Message relevant to the user.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.VeryVerbose
member.summary: Not important to the regular user, still of some interest to the curious

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Background process information, in case the user wants some detailed information on what is currently happening.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.SomewhatVerbose
member.summary: A footnote in current processing, rarely of interest to the user

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.System
member.summary: A message of some interest from an internal system persepctive, but largely irrelevant to the user.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Debug
member.summary: Something only of interest to a debugger

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.InternalComment
member.summary: This message barely made the cut from being culled. Of purely development internal interest, and even there is 'interest' a strong word for it.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevel.Warning
member.summary: This message is a warning, sure sign something went badly wrong

member.name: T:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier
member.summary: A modification to a given message's level

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.Name
member.summary: Name of the modifier. Prevents duplication in a multi-runspace scenario.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.Modifier
member.summary: The amount to modify the level by

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.IncludeFunctionName
member.summary: Apply modifier only to messages from this function.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.ExcludeFunctionName
member.summary: Apply modifier not when the message is written by this function.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.IncludeModuleName
member.summary: Apply modifier only to messages from this module

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.ExcludeModuleName
member.summary: Do not apply modifier to messages from this module

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.IncludeTags
member.summary: Only apply this modifier to a message that includes at least one of these tags

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.MessageLevelModifier.ExcludeTags
member.summary: Do not apply this modifier to a message that includes any of the following tags

member.summary: Tests, whether a message a message should be modified by this modiier
member.param: The name of the function writing the message
The name of the module, the function writing this message comes from
The tags of the message written

member.name: T:PSFramework.Message.PsfException
member.summary: Wrapper class that can emulate any exception for purpose of serialization without blowing up the storage space consumed

member.name: M:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.GetException
member.summary: Returns the original exception object that we interpreted. This is on purpose not a property, as we want to avoid messing with serialization size.
member.returns: The original exception that got thrown

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.Message
member.summary: The actual Exception Message

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.Source

member.summary: The HResult of the exception. Useful in debugging native code errors.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.HelpLink

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.Data

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.ErrorDetails

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.FullyQualifiedErrorId

member.name: F:PSFramework.Message.PsfException.InvocationInfo

member.name: T:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterClassAttribute
member.summary: Attribute marking a class

member.name: T:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute
member.summary: The attribute used to define the elements of a ParameterClass contract

member.name: P:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute.Type
member.summary: Returns the type of the element this attribute is supposed to be attached to.

member.name: P:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute.Behavior
member.summary: Returns the behavior to expect from the contracted element. This sets the expectations on how this element is likely to act.

member.name: M:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractAttribute.#ctor(PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractType,PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior)
member.summary: Ceates a perfectly common parameter contract attribute. For use with all parameter classes' public elements.

member.name: T:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior
member.summary: Defines how this element will behave

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.NotContracted
member.summary: This elements is not actually part of the contract. Generally you wouldn't want to add the attribute at all in that case. However, in some places it helps avoiding confusion.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Mandatory
member.summary: This element may never be null and must be considered in all assignments. Even if the element is de facto not nullable, all constructors must assign it.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Optional
member.summary: This element may contain data, but is not required to. In case of a method, it may simply do nothing

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Failable
member.summary: This method may throw an error when executing and should always be handled with try/catch. Use this on methods that use external calls.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Arbiter
member.summary: The content of the thus marked field determines the dependent's state. Generally, only if the arbiter is true, will the dependent elements be mandatory. This behavior may only be assigned to boolean fields.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Conditional
member.summary: This behavior can be assigned together with the 'Mandatory' behavior. It means the field is only mandatory if an arbiter field is present and set to true.

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractBehavior.Conversion
member.summary: Converts content. Generally applied only to operators, but some methods may also convert information.

member.name: T:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractType
member.summary: Defines what kind of element is granted the contract

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractType.Field
member.summary: The contracted element is a field containing a value

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractType.Method
member.summary: The contracted element is a method, performing an action

member.name: F:PSFramework.Parameter.ParameterContractType.Operator
member.summary: The contracted element is an operator, facilitating type conversion. Generally into a dedicated object type this parameterclass abstracts.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TabExpansion.TeppScriptMode.Full
member.summary: In full mode, the user is expected to provide the full TEPP scriptblock.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TabExpansion.TeppScriptMode.Auto

member.name: T:PSFramework.TaskEngine.Priority
member.summary: How high the priority of the task. Higher priority tasks take precedence over low priority tasks.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.Priority.Trivial
member.summary: This task is completely trivial and can be done whenever there is some spare time for it

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.Priority.Low
member.summary: The task is not very significant, but should be dealt with at some point

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.Priority.Medium
member.summary: Average priority task

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.Priority.High
member.summary: An important task that will take precedence over most other tasks

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.Priority.Critical
member.summary: A task so critical, that it should be considered to move it to synchronous execution instead.

member.name: T:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask
member.summary: An individual task assigned to the maintenance engine

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Name
member.summary: The name of the task to execute. No duplciates are possible.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Description
member.summary: A description of what the task is/should be doing

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Once
member.summary: Whether the task should be done once only

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Enabled
member.summary: Whether the task is enabled. Only enabled tasks will be executed

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Interval
member.summary: The interval at which the task should be performed

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Delay
member.summary: If the task need not be performed right away, it can be delayed, in order to prioritize more important initialization tasks

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Registered
member.summary: When was the task first registered. Duplicate registration calls will not increment this value.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.LastExecution
member.summary: When was the task last executed.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Priority
member.summary: How important is this task?

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.ScriptBlock
member.summary: The task code to execute

member.name: P:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.IsDue
member.summary: Whether the task is due and should be executed

member.name: P:PSFramework.TaskEngine.PsfTask.Pending
member.summary: Returns, whether there are any actions still pending. The Task Engine runspace will terminate if there are no pending tasks left.

member.name: T:PSFramework.TaskEngine.TaskHost
member.summary: Host class providing access to resources needed to schedule and execute tasks in the background

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.TaskHost.Tasks
member.summary: The register of available tasks.

member.name: F:PSFramework.TaskEngine.TaskHost.Cache
member.summary: Cache where modules can store cached data provided by tasks

member.name: P:PSFramework.TaskEngine.TaskHost.HasDueTasks
member.summary: Whether there are any due tasks

member.name: P:PSFramework.TaskEngine.TaskHost.HasPendingTasks
member.summary: Whether there are any tasks that still have an action pending

member.name: M:PSFramework.TaskEngine.TaskHost.GetNextTask(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns the next task to perform. Returns null when there are no more tasks to perform
member.param: List of tasks not to return, even if they are ready to execute again. This avoids one misconfigured task starving all lower priority tasks
